shapes

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Point

  • public final class Point
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a point on a 2-dimensional plane.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Alan Fowler acfowler@uw.edu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double DEFAULT_X
      A default value for the x coordinate.
      static double DEFAULT_Y
      A default value for the y coordinate.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Point()
      Constructs a point at the origin (0, 0).
      Point(double theX, double theY)
      Constructs a point using the provided coordinates.
      Point(Point theOtherPoint)
      This copy constructor creates a new Point as a copy of the specified Point.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      What is the distance to the specified point? precondition: theOtherPoint is not null

      What is the x coordinate?
      double getY()

      Set the x-coordinate to the specified value!
      void setY(double theY)
      Set the y-coordinate to the specified value!
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String containing the coordinate pair with a label : Point (x, y).
      void translate(double theX, double theY)
      Translate by the specified values!

    • Constructor Detail

      • Point

        public Point(double theX,
             double theY)
        Constructs a point using the provided coordinates.
        Parameters:
        theX - The x coordinate to assign to this point.
        theY - The y coordinate to assign to this point.

      • Point

        public Point()
        Constructs a point at the origin (0, 0).

      • Point

        public Point(Point theOtherPoint)
        This copy constructor creates a new Point as a copy of the specified Point. precondition: theOtherPoint is not null
        Parameters:
        theOtherPoint - a Point object to copy.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter is null

    • Method Detail

        public double getY()
        What is the y coordinate?
        Returns:
        the y coordinate

      • calculateDistance

        public double calculateDistance(Point theOtherPoint)
        What is the distance to the specified point? precondition: theOtherPoint is not null
        Parameters:
        theOtherPoint - The other point.
        Returns:
        the distance from the current point to the specified point
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if theOtherPoint is null

      • setX

        public void setX(double theX)
        Set the x-coordinate to the specified value!
        Parameters:
        theX - the new x value to set

      • setY

        public void setY(double theY)
        Set the y-coordinate to the specified value!
        Parameters:
        theY - the new y value to set

      • translate

        public void translate(double theX,
                      double theY)
        Translate by the specified values!
        Parameters:
        theX - The x distance to translate by.
        theY - The y distance to translate by.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String containing the coordinate pair with a label : Point (x, y). The coordinates are formatted to show 2 decimal places.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
